intro: Oldenlandia marginata, commonly known as the silverleaf spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and lance-shaped leaves with a silvery underside. The plant produces small, white or pale blue flowers in clusters, which bloom during the summer months. Its leaves are often covered in fine, white hairs, giving it a distinctive, almost metallic appearance. Oldenlandia marginata is adapted to thrive in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks.
